channel.title: Easy on Policy to Packets
channel.description: Recent content in Easy on Policy to Packets

item.title: [Writeup] LetsDefend - Challenge - Shellshock Attack
item.author: reedveggleston@gmail.com (Reed Eggleston)
item.description: Step-by-step LetsDefend challenge writeup analyzing Shellshock attack activity in a PCAP file using Wireshark, identifying the target server details and the injected command from a SOC analyst perspective.

item.title: [Writeup] LetsDefend - Challenge - Port Scan Activity
item.author: reedveggleston@gmail.com (Reed Eggleston)
item.description: Step-by-step LetsDefend challenge writeup analyzing port scan activity in a PCAP file using Wireshark, identifying the scanning host, discovered systems, and network indicators from a SOC analyst perspective.

item.title: [Writeup] LetsDefend - Challenge - Malicious Doc
item.author: reedveggleston@gmail.com (Reed Eggleston)
item.description: Step-by-step LetsDefend challenge writeup analyzing a malicious Word document using VirusTotal to identify RTF exploit behavior, CVE-2017-11882 abuse, payload delivery, and network communication from a SOC analyst perspective.

item.title: [Writeup] LetsDefend - Challenge - Remote Working
item.author: reedveggleston@gmail.com (Reed Eggleston)
item.description: Step-by-step LetsDefend challenge writeup analyzing a malicious XLS file using VirusTotal to identify detection signatures, dropped files, spyware download URLs, and file intelligence indicators from a SOC analyst perspective.

item.title: [Writeup] LetsDefend - Challenge - Malicious VBA
item.author: reedveggleston@gmail.com (Reed Eggleston)
item.description: Step-by-step LetsDefend challenge writeup analyzing a malicious VBA macro document, decoding obfuscated hex strings, identifying payload delivery, and investigating HTTP communication and WMI execution techniques from a SOC analyst perspective.

item.title: [Writeup] HackTheBox Labs - Challenge - Slippy
item.author: reedveggleston@gmail.com (Reed Eggleston)
item.description: Step-by-step HackTheBox “Slippy” challenge writeup demonstrating Zip Slip exploitation, Jinja2 SSTI abuse, and Flask-based web application compromise within a Docker environment.
